article_title: Deadly Disappointment Awaits at Ebola Clinics Due to Lack of Space
article_text:
Milton Mulbon arrived in a taxi at the gates of an Ebola clinic in Liberia's capital, Monrovia, with his 24-year-old daughter, Patience, bleeding in the back seat. Guards turned them away.

"They're telling me no space?" he protested, the taxi parked nearby. "She's lying down in there almost at the point of death!"

Taxis, ambulances, and even men pushing their sick in wheelbarrows are crisscrossing...

twitter.description: Taxis, ambulances, and even men pushing their sick in wheelbarrows are crisscrossing Monrovia, looking for an open bed in West Africa's overbooked Ebola clinics.
twitter.title: Deadly Disappointment Awaits at Ebola Clinics Due to Lack of Space

image.alt: Ebola patients are left to die because hospitals don't have enough beds

twitter.creator: @drewfhinshaw
